column2: ALTITUDE SICKNESS
Statement
The environment causes altitude sickness is usually of height over 2,500m (8,000 feet) above sea level
The environment causes altitude sickness is usually have avery high tempreture above 35°C (95℉)
The environment causes altitude sickness has lower oxygen percentage in the air compare to environments that do not cause altitude sickness
Use train instead of airplane when trevaling to the place that causes altitude sickness would increase the risk of having altitude sickness
Sleep longer than regular would increase the risk of having altitude sickness
Headache is one of the symptoms caused by altitude sickness
Loss of appetite is one of the symptoms caused by altitude sickness
Bleeding gums is one of the symptoms caused by altitude sickness
Trouble with sleeping is one of the symptoms caused by altitude sickness
Aerobic exercise immediately when arriving at the places in high altitudes can prevent altitude sickness
Taking prophylaxis medications can prevent altitude sickness
Drink caffeinated products, such as energy drinks and sodas can prevent altitude sickness
Drink alchol can prevent altitude sickness
Drink plenty of water can prevent altitude sickness
Avoiding the consumption of excess salt can prevent altitude sickness.
Altitude sickness is caused by reduced air pressure and lower oxygen levels at high altitudes.
Altitude sickness is caused by increased air pressure and higher oxygen levels at high altitudes.
You are at higher risk for altitude sickness if: you live at or near sea level and travel to a high altitude
You are at higher risk for altitude sickness if: you live in moutain area for too long
AMERICAN REVOLUTIONARY WAR
Statement
The American Revolutionary War is also known as “American War of Freedom”.
The American Revolutionary War took place between 1775 – 1783.
George Washington served as commander in chief of the Continental Army during the war.
A conflict between Great Britain and France started the war in 1775.
Spain joined the war as an ally of France.
In 1779, Germany entered the war.
In the Treaty of Paris, Great Britain recognised the sovereignty of the United States of America.
The Kingdom of Mysore entered the war against Great Britain in 1780.
Netherlands gained significant territory from Great Britain as a result of the war.
The Continental Congress voted for independence on July 2, 1776.
CARPENTER BEES
Statement
The species of ‘carpenter bees’ derive their name due to their nesting behavior.
There are more than 500 sub-species of carpenter bees.
All carpenter bees are typically sociable and live in large nests.
The carpenter bees species make nests by tunneling into hard plant material like wood and bamboo.
Carpenter bees eat wood.
Woodpeckers eat carpenter bees.
The abdomens of carpenter bees are completely covered with dense hair.
Most carpenter bees are all-black, or primarily black with some yellow or white pubescence.
Male carpenter bees are harmless since they lack stingers.
Carpenter bees are not considered a true structural pest. They do not spread throughout the entire structure, but prefer unpainted or finished wood.
THEORY OF EVOLUTION
Statement
Evolution is a theory about the origin of life.
Evolutionary theory implies that life evolved (and continues to evolve) randomly, or by chance alone.
Over time, species evolve towards being bigger, stronger, and more intelligent.
Evolution implies that individual organisms can evolve during a single lifespan.
Natural selection describes how organisms try to adapt. Natural selection involves organisms trying to adapt.
Each offspring differs from their parent(s) in minor, random ways.
Over time, populations can split or branch off into new species.
Modern synthesis is connecting natural selection, mutation theory, and Mendelian inheritance into a unified theory.
The forces of evolution are most evident when populations become isolated, either through geographic distance or by other mechanisms that prevent genetic exchange.
The modern understanding of evolution began with the publication of Charles Darwin's “On the Origin of Organisms”.
Turkey is to stop teaching Darwin's theory of evolution in high schools.
Thomas Henry Huxley was a friend of Charles Darwin.
NASA
Statement
NASA stands for National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
NASA conducts its work in two principal organizations, called mission directorates: Human Exploration/ Operations and Space Technology.
On Feb. 20, 1962, an Atlas rocket successfully carried Sen. John Glenn into orbit as the first human ever reached outer space.
The Apollo Program was the first United States human spaceflight program.
One of President John F. Kennedy's national goals was "landing a man on the Moon and returning him safely to the Earth”.
The Apollo 8 was the first mission achieved the goal of lunar landing and returning to earth.
The Lunar Module was designed to descend from lunar orbit to land two astronauts on the Moon and take them back to orbit to the Command Module.
The Command/Service Module was first designed to land on the moon, but later it changed the role to the translunar ferry used to transport the crew.
NASA's New Horizons spacecraft traveled through the solar system for nearly one decade to be the first to get an up-close look at Jupiter.
This is an attention check question. Please select the option 'TRUE'.
The Curiosity rover on Mars is in the midst of its ninth drilling campaign since landing on the Red Planet a little over three years ago.
LADEE stands for Lunar Atmosphere and Dust Environment Explorer.
The NASA's Hubble Space Telescope travels to stars, planets or galaxies.
Hubble has made more than 1.3 million observations since its mission began in 1990.
The twin Voyager 1 and 2 spacecraft are on their more-than-37-year journey to make the entry into interstellar space.
In August 2012 scientist lost connection to Voyager 1 and have never heard anything of it since today.
The astronaut Jeff Williams spent more than 500 days in space.
The NASA motto is “For tomorrow's future”.
Project Mercury was NASA's first human spaceflight program specialized in orbital and sub-orbital flight, with capsules only large enough to hold one pilot.
Skylab is the first space station launched into orbit by the United States.
Orcas Island
Statement
Orcas Island is located in the South Pacific Ocean
Orcas Island is located in Florida, USA
Orcas Island is located in British Columbia, Canada
Orcas Island has less than 1,000 population
Orcas Island has more than 1,000,000 population
Orcas Island is with a land area of 57.3 square miles (148.4 km²)
Orcas Island is neighboring San Juan Island
Orcas Island is neighboring The Bahamas
Orcas Island is the largest of the San Juan Islands
Orcas is shaped like a pair of saddlebags
Orcas is shaped like a tea cup
Henry Kellett assigned the name Orcas to Orcas Island
Christopher Columbus first discovered the Orcas Island
Orcas Island was used jointly by the US and England on 1847
The border disputes concerning the island between the US and Greate Britain,were not settled until 1971.
The Pig War was a confrontation in 1859 between the United States and Great Britain
So far there is no airport on Orcas Island
Camp Orkila is located on the Orcas Island
There is no highway on Orcas Island
The highest point in the Orcas Island is less than 500 meters ( 1640 feet)
Sangre de Cristo Mountains
Statement
The Rocky Mountains reach from Mexico in the south up to Canada in the north.
Although the particular origin of the name is unclear, it has been in use since the early 19th century.
Sangre de Christo is Spanish for “Blood of Christ”.
Blanca Peak is the highest summit of the Rocky Mountains.
Blanca Peak is located at the southern end of the Sangre de Cristo Range.
Mount Phillips is formerly called Clear Peak Mountain.
The Timberline in these mountains is unusually high.
The mountains were chosen for a scene in the movie “Lone Fighter” .
The environmental writer Tom Wolf wrote a book about the “Sangre de Cristo”´s.
The Utes, the oldest continuous residents of what is now Colorado, arrived in the Sangre de Cristo region as early as 1300 A.D.
Sun Tzu
Statement
Sun Tzu's best known work is "The art of war".
Sun Tzu reportedly lived during the Han Dynasty.
Sun Tzu was reportedly a famous general during his lifetime.
Sun Tzu believed that war is a very heroic endeavor.
Most of our knowledge about Sun Tzu is based on the works of the historian Sima Qian.
In 1972, ancient bamboo slips featuring an early version of the Art of War were discovered in China.
The Art of War features a detailed chapter on punishments during wartime. (false). - Wikipedia (art of war).
The following quote is from the Art of War: "All warfare is based on deception."
The following quote is from the Art of War: "War is the continuation of politics by other means."
The Art of War features a detailed chapter on the use of spies during wartime.
Sun Tzu was reportedly the inventor of the repeating crossbow.
Sun Tzu wrote in the art of war (varying translations): "For to win one hundred victories in one hundred battles is not the acme of skill. To subdue the enemy without fighting is the acme of skill."
Sun Tzu reportedly said (varying translations): "The strong man is strongest when alone."
Sun Tzu's "The Art of War" is still popular among business executives, military leaders, and politicians.

The following quote is from the Art of War: "All warfare is based on deception. Hence, when we are able to attack, we must seem unable; when using our forces, we must appear inactive; when we are near, we must make the enemy believe we are far away; when far away, we must make him believe we are near."
Tornado
Statement
Tornado is a synonym for hurricane.
The word tornado is probably derived from the Spanish word “tornear”.
Twister is a synonym for tornado.
Tornados do rotate clockwise or counter-clockwise.
Tornados happen frequently in Antarctica as well.
The Fujimori scale is used to measure the strength of tornadoes.
The F-Scale classifies the levels of intensity of tornadoes based on the resulting damage.
Tornadoes can form multiple vortices.
Tornados happen frequently along the so called “tornado road”.
A “dust devil” is a certain kind of tornado.
Tornados are not visible on RADAR systems.
Tornados are much more frequent in “El Nino” years.
Highway overpasses provide adequate shelter from tornadoes.
A tornado plays an important role in the movie “The Wizard of Oz”.
There is a phenomenon called “Space Tornadoes”.
A tornado appears from the base of the storm.
There are no tornadoes in South America
In USA peak tornado occurrence is March through May.
3 out of every 4 tornadoes in the world happen in the United States.
Tornadoes can be very destructive in nature with their speed ranging from 200mph to 600mph.
USS Cole Bombing
Statement
A boat with explosive material rammed the USS Cole, while it was entering the port Aden.
The USS Cole is a guided missile destroyer of the Arleigh-Burke class.
The USS Cole bombing was an terrorist attack. The terror organization Al-Schabab claimed responsibility for it.
Seventeen American sailors were killed and 39 injured in the attack.
Several individuals have been described as the USS Cole bombing mastermind.
As a result of the USS Cole bombing, the U.S. Navy began to reassess its anti-terrorism and force protection methods.
The bombing was a suicidal attack.
Abd al-Rahim al-Nashiri, a suspected mastermind behind the Cole bombing was arrested in 2002.
After the attack the online newspaper “The Telegraph” wrote the bombed US warship was defended by sailors with unloaded guns.
At the time of the attack the Cole was operating under Force Protection Condition Charlie.
U.S. Navy ships began making refueling stops in Aden in January 1999.
The ship itself sunk at the attack, but was salvaged by the US Army afterwards.
